result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter J. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--To pay statutory costs of $243
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge

--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

Arresting Agency: FAPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: with elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached

Case called at 10:45 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Peter J. Johnson in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--To pay statutory costs of $243
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

No driver license suspension
Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 10:56 am

Case called at 1:30pm [mo]
[Reserve Judge Frankel presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Peter J. Johnson in court with attorney David Zarwell.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Zarwell requests an additional status conference
--no objection from DA Happ
The Court confirms Mr. Johnson's address on file
The Court continues Mr. Johnson's bond as set. 
recess: 1:32pm

Case called at 9:55 am [Clerk SH] 
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Peter J. Johnson in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $500 signature bond, with conditions: 
-Absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
-No use of drug paraphernalia 
-No possession of needles unless prescribed
-Booking at JCSD
Recess: 9:59 am
